Title: ktsuss: Privilege escalation
Synopsis:
Two vulnerabilities have been found in ktsuss, allowing local
    attackers to gain escalated privileges.

Background.Text: ktsuss is a simple, graphical version of su written in C and GTK+.

Description.Text:
Two vulnerabilities have been found in ktuss:

  • Under specific circumstances, ktsuss skips authentication and fails to change the effective UID back to the real UID (CVE-2011-2921).
  • The GTK interface spawned by the ktsuss binary is run as root (CVE-2011-2922).

Impact.Text: A local attacker could gain escalated privileges and use the "GTK_MODULES" environment variable to possibly execute arbitrary code with root privileges.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text:
Gentoo discontinued support for ktsuss. We recommend that users unmerge
      ktsuss:
